messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Uesugi and Takeda books-opinions
messages.msgSnippet: ... From: Mikiko Letham  To:  Sent: Sunday, August 04, 2002 2:51 PM Subject: Re: [samuraihistory]
messages.messageBody:
----- Original Message -----
From: Mikiko Letham <mickey.letham@...>
To: <samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Sunday, August 04, 2002 2:51 PM
Subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Uesugi and Takeda books-opinions


> Both books are short 'booklets' about 6"x4" with glossy print. The Takeda
> book is 32 pages long and includes some background detail, a synopsis of
the
> battle of Mikata-ga-hara, 4 color pages of banners and sashimonos, a
listing
> of his generals and number of samurai per. The Uesugi is 40 pages and has
> much the same. it also includes a list of battles arranged by area, a
> synopsis of the battle of Tedorigawa. Daisho also has one on II Naomasa,
and
> promises one on the Sanada family.
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: ggouveia312000 <ggouveia@...>
> To: <samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com>
> Sent: Wednesday, July 31, 2002 2:08 AM
> Subject: [samuraihistory] Uesugi and Takeda books-opinions
>
>
> > I just ordered 2 books, one on Takeda and one on Uesugi from Daisho
> > publishing. What are these books like?
> >
> >
> >
> >
> > Samurai Archives: http://www.samurai-archives.com
> > ---

http://docs.yahoo.com/info/terms/

messages.subject: Uesugi and Takeda books-opinions
messages.msgSnippet: I just ordered 2 books, one on Takeda and one on Uesugi from Daisho publishing. What are these books like?
messages.messageBody:
I just ordered 2 books, one on Takeda and one on Uesugi from Daisho
publishing. What are these books like?
